answers.answer: Hi,A complete work-up is required to diagnose the sudden postural collapse in your mother. It could be due to peripheral neuropathy, drug induced (especially antihypertensives, you mentioned about her being on some), cardiovascular disorders (arryhthmias, pulmonary hypertension), brain diseases (stroke, basilar artery migraine), decreased blood sugar etc.

question: I am trying to search out answers to what could possibly going on with my mother.  She has tardive dyskinesia, which is being controlled by tetrabenazine, currently has rapid foot movement at night, while laying down and my biggest concern is that she is FALLING DOWN all the time.  Out of the blue she will just fall either frontwards or backwards.  This happens like twice a day, being on a flat surface.She has severe lower back pain and has in the past had 3 of the lower vertebrea's fused together and set in a cage.  She has type II diabetes, hyatel hernia, high cholesterol and high blood pressure which is monitored by medication.  All of her brain MRI's show nothing of concern (small mini strokes).Any ideas of what could be going on to cause her to fall just like that?  Could this be related to her spine?  Any suggestions on what the next step could be to find answers?Thank you so much.
title: Movement Disorder
